plugin_info.plugin_description: Export a network from Hydra to a gams input text file.
plugin_info.plugin_epilog: For more information visit hydra platform website

arg.name: network
arg.help: ID of the network where results will be imported to. This coincides with the network exported to GAMS..

arg.name: scenario
arg.help: ID of the underlying scenario used for the most recent simulation run.

arg.name: time-axis
arg.help: Time axis for the modelling period (a list of comma separated time stamps). Either the time axis or a start-time, end-time, time-step combination MUST be specified.

arg.name: start-date
arg.help: Start date of the time period used for simulation. Must be after 1900-01-01.

arg.name: end-date
arg.help: End date of the time period used for simulation. Must be after 1900-01-01.

arg.name: time-step
arg.help: Time step used for simulation. The time step needs to be specified as a valid time length as supported by Hydra's unit conversion function (e.g. 1 s, 3 min, 2 h, 4 day, 1 mon, 1 yr)

arg.name: template
arg.help: ID of the template used for exporting resources. Attributes that don't belong to this template are ignored.

arg.name: gams-path
arg.help: File path of the GAMS installation (the folder containing gams.exe or equivalent). This is only necessary if gams is installed in a non-standard location.

arg.name: server_url
arg.help: Specify the URL of the server to which this plug-in connects.

arg.name: session_id
arg.help: Specify the session ID for the connection. If not specified, the plugin will try to connect based on the credentials it finds in config.

arg.name: Export by Type
arg.help: Check to export data by types rather than by attributes.

arg.name: Export Links by Name
arg.help: Export links by their name, rather than by their start, end node. If two nodes can be connected by more than one link, you should choose this option.
